meta.title: COVID19/Information - School District of Lodi

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection2181 fsHasTheme2

p.span: As a result of staff and parent survey input we are making the following modifications to our online instruction plan Collaboration/Catch Up Days and Grading information. Please see the information below under those titles.

a.span:
Staff COVID 19 INFORMATION
AND LEAVE REQUEST FORMS

FOOD SERVICE INFORMATION
FOR MCPRIDE LUNCHES

li.a: How to Talk to your Kids about COVID 19
Online Instruction Guidance for Parents and Students

p.span: We are designating the additional date of Friday, April 17th, along with the already designated date of May 1st, as staff collaboration/student catchup days. No online instruction will be expected on either of these two collaboration days, These two days are being designated to allow for:

li.span: staff to collaborate (remotely) with their grade level or department members and/or individually plan for continued online student instruction.
staff members have some non-instructional time to personally connect with individual students or families who may need some additional help or emotional support.
students to catchup on assignments or project work.

a.span: Colaboración / Días de recuperación

span.a: Kev Koom Tes / Txais Tau Txhua Hnub

a.span: Parent Note 4/17/20 - Updates due to Governor Ever's extension of Safe at Home order

span.a: Nota para padres 17/4/20 - Actualizaciones debido a la extensión del Gobernador Ever de la orden Safe at Home

br.a: Niam Txiv Daim Lus Cog Tseg 4/17/20 - Xov Xwm Tshiab Raws Li Governor tau hais txog qhov yuav muaj kev nyab xeeb ntxiv rau hauv tsev

a.span: Online Learning Update

span.a: Actualización de aprendizaje en línea - Spanish

p.span:
The district has determined to use a pass/no pass grading system for grades 6-12 and a progress reporting system for grades 4K/5. The attached grading summary document provides more information regarding this issue:
SDL 4K-5 Guidance for Grading - COVID-19
SDL 6-12 Guidance for Grading - COVID-19

Calificación: hemos decidido utilizar un sistema de calificación aprobado / no aprobado para los grados 6-12 y un sistema de informe de progreso para los grados 4K / 5. Los documentos de resumen de calificaciones adjuntos proporcionan más información sobre este tema:

span.a: SDL 4K-5 Guía para la calificación - COVID-19

br.a: SDL 6-12 Guía para la calificación - COVID-19

p.span: Kev Muab Qib - Peb tau txiav txim siab siv qhov pass / tsis muaj qhov muab qhab nia hla rau qib 6-12 thiab txheej txheem qhia nce qib rau qib 4K / 5. Daim ntawv sau cov ntsiab lus sau muab sau ua ke muaj cov lus qhia ntxiv txog qhov teeb meem no:

span.a: SDL 4K-5 Cov Lus Qhia rau rau Qib - COVID-19

br.a: SDL 6-12 Cov Kev Qhia rau rau Qib - COVID-19

h2.a: How to Talk to your Kids about COVID 19

h6.span:
Please see the resources listed below for current information on the Coronavirus (COVID-19) and some links that share information about how to talk with children about this virus.
Consider talking with your children about these developments as a family. Some suggestions include:

li.span: Stick to the facts. It can be scary to hear about a disease outbreak, but learning the facts can help ease your mind.
Remind your family that when we are prepared for difficult situations, we make informed decisions and have more control.

ul.li: It's important that we avoid assumptions or stereotypes about who you think may be sick. Viruses cannot target people from specific populations, ethnicities, or racial backgrounds. A person’s race does not make them more or less likely to be sick or to get sick.

h6.span: Watch for behavior changes in your child

p.span: Not all children and teens respond to stress in the same way. Some common changes to watch for include:

li.span: Excessive crying or irritation in younger children

Returning to behaviors they have outgrown (for example, toileting accidents or
bedwetting)
Excessive worry or sadness
Unhealthy eating or sleeping habits
Irritability and “acting out” behaviors in teens
Poor school performance or avoiding school
Difficulty with attention and concentration
Avoidance of activities enjoyed in the past
Unexplained headaches or body pain
Use of alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs

h6.span: Additional resources for talking with your family:

a.span: video aimed at kids that explains coronavirus
Webcomic and 3-minute audio story aimed at kids on coronavirus
How to Talk to Your Kids about coronavirus (PBS/Daniel Tiger - for young children)
Article and podcast on "What to Say to Kids When the News is Scary"
"Talking to Teens and Tweens About Coronavirus"

li.span: The National Association of School Psychologists have an entire page of resources on this topic here.

a.span: Tips for talking to kids about the pandemic: https://store.samhsa.gov/product/Talking-With-Children-Tips-for-Caregivers-Parents-and-Teachers-During-Infectious-Disease-Outbreaks/PEP20-01-01-006

p.span:
Financial Resources to Help Get Through COVID-19:
https://fyi.extension.wisc.edu/toughtimes/covid-19-financial-resources/

br.span: Help with Food and Clothing is available at Reach out Lodi. Please call 608-592-4592

p.span: All food service information will be updated on our Food Service page.
Please click on the button below to be redirected.

a.span:
Food SErvice and McPride Meals
Information

span.a: Mental Health Resources for Adolescents and Young Adults

br.a: CDC Resources on Stress and Coping
National Alliance on Mental Illness - Find Support Page

a.span: Mental Health America of Wisconsin - COVID-19 Resource Page

li.span: Crisis Lines
Text “HOPELINE” to 741741
Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 608-280-2600 or 1-800-273-8255
Briarpatch Helpline: 1-800-798-1126
Trevor Lifeline for LGBTQ+: 1-866-488-7386 or click here for Trevor Text & Trevor Chat
24/7 SAMHSA Disaster Distress Helpline - 1-800-985-5990
24/7 Parental Stress Line - 1-800-632-8188
Domestic Abuse Intervention Services (DAIS) Help Line: 608-251-4445 or 800-747-4045, If you are in immediate danger, call 911.

h2.a: Online Instruction Guidance for Parents and Students

p.span: Due to the school closure, Lodi’s educators are adjusting their approach to a remote learning setting. Our plan is to continue to provide students with the instruction, resources, and feedback they need to continue to learn and grow. In addition to the daily instruction students receive, the School District of Lodi wants to support families by offering enrichment resources that are optional for students to explore on their own. During these unprecedented times we are reminded how wonderful it is to be in a strong community like Lodi that values education; thank you for all you are doing at home with your student(s) to help them continue to learn and grow under these circumstances.

a.span: Optional Remote Teaching Tools for Families (Grades 4K-12)

span.a: Herramientas de enseñanza remota opcionales para familias (Grados 4K-12)
